question: In which cricket world cup, Australia won its first "Cricket World Cup Champion" title?
explanation: In 1987 cricket world cup, Australia won its first "Cricket World Cup Champion" title. India and Pakistan jointly hosted the 1987 tournament, the first time that the competition was held outside England. Australia won the championship by defeating England by 7 runs in the final, the closest margin in the World Cup final until the 2019 edition between England and New Zealand.
